snippet: In addition to federal testing, the state of Virginia will have vehicles hit Trinity’s ET-Plus guardrails at slight angles — said to be representative of many car accidents.
abstract: Virginia will test guardrails made by Trinity Industries, group accused of producing faulty guardrails that can jam and spear through vehicles.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: In addition to federal testing, the state of Virginia will have vehicles hit Trinity’s ET-Plus guardrails at slight angles — said to be representative of many car accidents.

headline.main: Trinity Guardrails Will Face Tests Again, This Time by the State of Virginia
headline.print_headline: Trinity Guardrails Will Face Tests Again, This Time by the State of Virginia
